title: An Essential Guide To Panama City’s Casco Antiguo, A Burgeoning Hotspot Worth The Trip
description: Panama City was once just a layover destination, but as travelers finally start to stick around, they’re finding its Casco Antiguo to be the coolest capital in the region.
content:
As sailors come over the crest to pass through the Panama Canal towards Panama City, they’re often surprised to see a skyline packed with skyscrapers, the effect of decades of the country’s stability and strategic location making it the region’s busiest business capital.

Panama City has thrived as a destination for passing through rather than sticking around, with tourism taking a comfortable back seat in the country’s GDP. However, discerning visitors have long known that the seeds of opportunity for transforming this city into a destination all its own have always been there.

Nowhere is that more true than in the Casco Antiguo, the city’s historic center dating back to the 1600s, where cathedral bells rings, historic churches reign and centuries-old mansions are finally being reclaimed from the passage of time. While the neighborhood languished for years and many parts lay forgotten, visitors recently started to realize there's something worth seeing here. As new hotels, restaurants, cafes and bar spring up upon hitoric foundations, the neighborhood’s renaissance is igniting Panama City’s tourism like never before.

Now, it’s easier to visit than ever to visit Panama City thanks to Copa Airlines Stopover Program, which allows travels to spend up to seven extra days in Panama when flying the airline, at no additional airline fee.

Looking to beat the crowds and experience Panama City's Casco Antiguo before becomes the new talk of travel? Read on for a guide to the best of Panama City’s most enigmatic neighborhood.

Hotel La Compañía marries centuries of history in the heart of the historic center with thoughtful luxuries that makes it part iconic place to stay, part destination all to its own. The hotel's 88 rooms are spread across three wings that each have their roots in different centuries of the history, from 17th-century Spanish colonial section and fine French architecture to Beaux-Arts American inspiration from the 1900s. Multiple dining venues, divine city views and friendly service are next level.

Sofitel Legend Casco Viejo got its start in an early 20th-century Club Union building designed by James C. Wright shortly after the opening of the Panama Canal, giving it an instant air of grandeur when it reopened in 2023 as one of the neighborhood’s most historic properties. Now, its luxe waterfront rooms make it a coveted Casco Antiguo spot complete with spa, event spaces and fine dining.

The age-old mansions of Casco Antiguo are slowly being saved, many transformed into boutique hotels that offer a personalized take on the centuries-old character of neighborhood. Amarla Boutique Hotel is the top choice among them, with handpicked decor in each of its eight rooms, a gorgeous rooftop space, and one of the best restaurants in the entire city.

What To Do

To take a Casco Antiguo walking tour with Ancon Expeditions it to fall in love with tours all over again, even if you haven’t always been their biggest fan. Packed with history and peppered with funny anecdotes, these tours dive into the intricately-layered history of the city, and can be tailored to include a foodie focus, a coffee or chocolate tasting experience and plenty more along the way.

As a travel writer and coffee addict currently based in Medellin, Colombia I have a pride towards Colombian coffee, but I have to hand it to Panama's prized geisha coffee when it comes to flavor, feel and tasting experience. Geisha tasting opportunities are a dime a dozen in Casco Antiguo, but the best place to try it is with Geisha Experiences, who have a staff of passionate, prepared guides who really know what they’re talking about

A brand new museum located on the edge of the Casco Antiguo, Museo Casa Coronel del Cacao y del Chocolate makes an art of out of Panama's burgeoning chocolate industry, bringing visitors along for the ride—and the taste test. Set in a recently restored historic mansion, a visit is the perfect combination of chocolate tasting experience and historic architectural tour.

It's all about fine dining, white tablecloth service and delicious handmade fare at Villa Ana 1928, once the home of one of Panama City’s most famous society ladies and now a multi-level restaurant and bar space complete with cigar bar and rooftop. Make sure to time your visit for a night of live music to be immediately transports you back to one of Panama City’s most regal eras.

It seemed every local I spoke with in Panama City was set on sending me to Fonda Lo Que Hay during my stay in Casco Antiguo. Named one of the best restaurants in Latin America after its debut, this casual spot with a cool bar and plenty of family-style seating ushers guests into the most authentic yet elevated Panamanian dining destinations in the neighborhood. Affordable prices and rave reviews means you might have to wait for a table.

Panamanian cuisine is going through something of a renaissance, led in no small part by passionate chefs like Jose Aparicio at Kaandela. An up and coming local chef calls his creations a mix of "Panama’s culinary traditions reinterpreted with a modern edge," offers a good mix of surf and turf options with plenty of Caribbean flavor and flare.

Nestled off the courtyard in the French wing of Hotel La Compañía, Exilio Bar oozes a grandeur and stately luxury that draws Panama City's elite into Casco Antiguo for drinks to close the day. It preserves the history of its locale without being ostentatious, and is perfectly balanced by taking a second round of drinks at the hotel’s rooftop bar at sunset.

Pedro Mandinga is first and foremost a rum distillery and brand with a variety of thoughtfully crafted liquors, so you know its Pedro Mandinga Rum Bar in Casco Antiguo has to be good. You really can't go wrong with anything on their full menu of food (though the patacones and torrejitas are divine), but guests can't leave without a tasting of their unique rums distilled with ingredients like geisha coffee, cacao and coconut.

Casco Antiguo is all about the rooftops, and there's none better than Tántalo if you’re looking to get down. Tántalo tends to have a mix of visitors and locals alike here to gawk at the incredible view of both old town streets and modern city skyscrapers.There’s a fun drink menu and full menu of food served until the evening, though the party goes on into the wee hours.

An impossibly cool design store located on Casco Antiguo's Calle de los Sombreros, Monsters is packed with colorfully designed, Panama inspired t-shirts, jewelry, stickers, home decor pieces and so much more, making it the perfect stop for a one of a kind souvenir. Here you'll want to linger: the shop shares space with a matcha cafe and tea house to fuel the rest of your Casco Antiguo adventures.

A curated collection of lightweight, resort ware style-clothes, bags and accessories will draw you into Etnik, but just wait until you see the jewelry. Locally designed fine jewelry takes inspiration from pre-Columbian indigenous discoveries and long-loved textile designs for handcrafted pieces that make a statement.

Panama hats actually originated in Ecuador, but they got their name when President Theodore Roosevelt wore one when he visited Panama City during the construction of the Panama Canal. Now, you'll find them for sale everywhere, but Victor’s Panama Hats does a great job offering a wide range or hand-produced hats you’ll love, and will happy walk clients through their creation process from start to finish.
summary: Panama City's Casco Antiguo, the city's historic center dating back to the 1600s, is becoming a major draw for visitors due to its transformation into a destination. New hotels, restaurants, cafes and bars have been added to the area, with hotels, cafes, and bars opening up. The CascoAntiguo's renaissance is igniting Panama City’s tourism like never before. The Copa Airlines Stopover Program allows travelers to spend up to seven extra days in Panama when flying the airline, without additional airline fee. Hotel La Compañía marries centuries of history with luxury offerings, including multiple dining venues, city views, and a rooftop bar with cigar bar. Geisha tasting opportunities are also a must-have experience. Travel writer and coffee addict recommends a walking tour with Ancon Expeditions, which includes a foodie focus, a coffee or chocolate tasting experience, and tours tailored to include historical tours.
shortSummary: Panama City’s historic Casco Antiguo neighborhood, revitalizing its historic center with hotels, restaurants, and a new museum, is a must-see destination for tourists.

Amarla Boutique Hotel Casco Viejo
Is your dream home away from home. You’ll discover what that means the moment you step inside. Our warm and attentive service, and attention to detail are the foundations of everything we do. That’s why we are considered one of the best boutique hotels in Panama.
Experience Colonial Charm with Modern Comfort
Our boutique hotel is set in a beautifully restored colonial home, where every corner tells a story. The warm colors, handcrafted details, and intimate spaces are designed to make you feel both inspired and at peace.
Besides, our location in Casco Viejo allows you to explore the historic center of Panama City just steps from your room.
Your Stay at Amarla Boutique Hotel Casco Viejo
Located in the heart of Panama City’s most iconic neighborhood, Amarla Boutique Hotel Casco Viejo blends colonial elegance with curated experiences. Whether you’re exploring the charm of the Old Town or relaxing in our thoughtfully designed rooms, your stay will be truly unforgettable.
That’s why so many of our guests return—because every stay feels like coming home, but better.
Welcome
Your family’s perfect getaway. Prepare to be delighted when you stay at Panama’s enchanting boutique hotel, Amarla Boutique Hotel in Casco. Steeped in history and full of charm, Amarla Boutique Hotel is located right in the heart of historic Panama. We offer an oasis of calm within easy walking distance of many of Panama’s most memorable sights.
Let us share our manifesto with you and the story of how we transformed this historic colonial home into a beautiful boutique hotel that welcomes families with open arms. At Amarla Boutique Hotel, we provide a welcoming retreat for travellers of all ages, where every corner tells a story, and every stay creates lasting memories.
Press Features
Press Features
Our Rooms
Amarla has just eight en-suite guest rooms, each beautifully decorated with select pieces from local craftsmen and artisans. Amarla is perfectly sized for our team to become acquainted with every one of our guests. We love the opportunity this gives us to share our local knowledge and passion for Panama.
Our Hotel
Located in historic Casco Viejo, known locally as San Felipe barrio, Amarla Boutique Hotel Casco, Panama lies in the heart of the old city. It is remarkably peaceful despite its central location. Famous attractions such as Canal Museum, Cathedral Basilica Metropolitana and Molas Museum are just a short walk away. But you don’t have to travel even that far. Our rooftop jacuzzi provides the ultimate in relaxation with a backdrop of stunning views across Casco Viejo and Panama Bay. While our hotel’s signature restaurant Kaandela, offers some of the finest cuisine in the city. Stay with us to experience true Panamanian hospitality.
Experiences
Embrace your inner Latin spirit and ignite your passion with our hand-picked collection of in-house activities and experiences. We want to share with you the opportunity to discover more about our country and our culture. You can join us to explore the spectacular natural wonders and stunning wildlife around Panama. Or why not let us help you create your own personal unforgettable made-to-measure experiences. The choice is yours.
Gastronomy
Our signature restaurant, Kaandela features recipes based around raw, cold and open-fire cooking. We experiment with local and global flavors, injecting our inner fire into everything we do. Kaandela restaurant, along with Kaandela Bar, offer an unmissable experience to taste and hear the stories behind our dishes accompanied by perfect drink-pairings designed by our expert mixologist and sommelier. This is a tasting experience that will stay with you long after the meal is done.
Wake up to tranquility at Amarla, then as the sun sets, immerse yourself in the vibrant energy of Kaandela, where vibrant music and Panamanian-inspired cuisine create an unforgettable experience.
Events
Host your next event at the Amarla Boutique Hotel in Panama’s historic Casco Viejo. Located in a peaceful but central area of the old quarter, our beautiful hotel is the perfect venue in Panama for your next private event, retreat or wedding. The Amarla Boutique Hotel is in the heart of the vibrant old town. It’s fully equipped to handle everything your special event needs. We offer live music, areas for private events, room for micro-weddings, space for social networking and ‘petits’ corporate events.
Weddings
Imagine saying, ‘I do’ against the unforgettable backdrop of the stunning city of Panama. It’s a unique setting for a joyous union. Whatever your micro-wedding requirements we’ll ensure your special day goes smoothly. From a cocktail reception on our rooftop, to a seated dinner in the middle of our tropical patio, bring us your micro-wedding dreams and watch as we make them come true.
The Concept
Amarla is an affair of the heart. We were involved in the overseeing of almost every piece of furniture. in Amarla, which has been built mostly from local wood and finished with the expert skill of a true artisan. Most our furniture was crafted by local artisans, with a few exceptions that were made by friends in Santa Marta, Colombia.
Our Manifesto
To welcome guests with an open heart, To serve with joy, And create meaningful and unforgettable experiences. We celebrate a culture of service and cooperation, Supporting one another to grow as individuals and as a team, We evolve and challenge ourselves consistently, And strive to serve our communities and environment.
We are creative, adventurous, passionate and dedicated, We inspire authentic moments in beautiful places, Amarla is luxury with heart.

This area, rich in history with its 17th-century architecture, is experiencing a renaissance with new hotels, restaurants, and cultural attractions, making it increasingly appealing to visitors. Copa Airlines' Stopover Program further facilitates tourism by allowing travelers to explore Panama City for up to seven days without additional airfare, enhancing the city's profile as a must-visit location.
